column4: can anybody tell me how to set 1280x800 resolution in 14'' laptop on ubuntu 10.04
have you tried a later release, if you have a fancy new intel gpu, you may benefit from the newer drivers and kernel
there is a ppa for it but it won't be supported here if you use it
if you use a different kernel to the one intended for your OS it won't be supported here
the other way is to form an xorg.conf file to make the display work
I'd try Oneiric liveCD to see if it helps
you will need:  gksudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf     to get write access

there are samples online, you will fid some around if you search, you are going to be trying the configs and if you get no desktop you will need to drop to root recovery mode or TTY1 to rename the file, long process
you could show your customer this: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Releases
if they want lucid because it is LTS, you can show them that Oneiric (latest stable) is LTS at the same time as Lucid desktop
the support for Lucid deskop and Oneiric desktop expires at the same time, so I would query why Lucid is needed
does it work ok in Oneiric?
